terms.निर्गुण वाक्यानां: of the statements (vakya) regarding the formless/non-dual (nirguna) reality
terms.सगुणापेक्षत्वेन: by considering the dependance on the qualified (saguna) reality
terms.परत्वात्: due to the supremacy or superiority
terms.Meaning: This verse, attributed to Shank: dual reality (nirguna) are superior (paratvat) or more powerful because they can account for or relate to the qualified or manifest reality (saguna) through their emphasis on the supreme nature of the formless. In other words, acknowledging the formless as the ultimate foundation allows for a greater understanding and integration of the manifest world.
